page.title: 02Traveller's Guide to Bexhill
page.content: Bexhill's{beaches}are very stoney and there is very little sand. You can go for very nice walks on Galley Hill on the cliffs. On the{seafront}there is the De La Warr Pavilion, the Bexhill sailing club and angling club. The De La Warr Pavilion was designed by the Bauhaus architects Mendelsohn and Chermayeff and opened in 1935. In it there is a theatre which seats 1200 people, a ballroom, banqueting suite, restaurant and sun terace. The sailing club is a new building on the beach and has sailing races at the weekend during the summer. There is a large park called{Egerton Park}where you can hire a boat and row on the pond. The{shops}are mainly small and you have to go to Eastbourne or Hastings for the large stores.
